programmes.show_name: Can You Keep It Up For A Week?
programmes.show_description: Comedy. Annette will marry Gil, her hapless boyfriend, on condition he keeps his new job for a week without getting up to mischief with other women. Contains sexual scenes and 70s social attitudes.
5/8. In Kent, metal worker John tackles a cut-price riverboat restoration using ingenious workarounds. Can he make a home of his own?
Archaeologists Alex and Peter and historian Ruth try Edwardian life for a year. The team leave the farm in search of work and head to the coast to reap the ocean's bounty.
7/15. Rick eats the ultimate jerk chicken in Bristol and witnesses the healing power of food at a café staffed by victims of slavery. He makes a modern UK favourite, the burrito.

12/35. Sylvia and Matthew in Wokingham want a romantic garden full of scent, blooms and enchantment. For £5,000, can Flo and Lee bring back that loving feeling?
Archaeologists Alex and Peter and historian Ruth try Edwardian life for a year. Alex and Peter go down a copper mine, just a few hundred yards from their cottage.
8/15. Rick visits a Suffolk bakery making artisan sourdough. He meets an old friend who sells fresh fish on the beach, and back at home, he has a go at making sushi.
6/9. Alan and the garden make-over team transform a Hull garden into Mediterranean hideaway for Macmillan nurse Maggie, which has a play-zone for her grandchildren.
17/20. An antiques expert, a market trader and an upcycler compete to make the most money. Charles Hanson, Melissa Downhill and Anthony Devine visit Kendal.
Dave Wellman comes to the aid of a couple in Cambridge, whose new cottage kitchen is in need of serious work. 5/20
Dave Wellman is in Romford tackling a bouncy wooden floor with wood worm and lays an oak floor. 6/20
3/8. A bidding war breaks out over vintage Hermes bags. Also under the hammer: a print by street artist Invader and the coolest skateboard going, designed by the late Virgil Abloh.
6/8. After 25 years living in New Zealand, Keith and Pam dream of touring the UK's waterways. But it's their first boat and they'll need to learn the ropes

Stories of people who have experienced infidelity, the reasons why people stray outside their relationship and if a relationship can ever survive.
Bad girls don't come to London, they're made in London. Suzy, a young country girl, is led astray by the wild members of a rock group. Contains nudity and 70s social attitudes.

programmes.show_name: Mary Millington: Come Play With Me
programmes.show_description: Two hapless forgers hide out in a Scottish manor house. When a troupe of dancing girls join them musical numbers, comedy and sauce ensues. Contains sexual scenes.
6/8. After 25 years living in New Zealand, Keith and Pam dream of touring the UK's waterways. But it's their first boat and they'll need to learn the ropes

13/35. Charlie and Lee are in Sutton Coldfield to create an Australian-inspired space to rekindle happy memories for Claire and Andy of their years spent living in Melbourne.
It is February and archaeologists Alex Langlands and Peter Ginn and historian Ruth Goodman approach the halfway point in their year on the Edwardian Farm.
9/15. Rick is in London. He discovers how Chinese dim sum and Italian mozzarella are made, before tucking into a full English breakfast with Stuart Maconie.
7/9. Alan Titchmarsh and his team surprises a couple of real Golden Girls with a future-proofed vintage style garden that celebrates their incredible lives.
18/20. An antiques expert, a market trader and an upcycler compete to make the most money. Roo Irvine, Danny Sebastian and Nessa Doran O'Reilly head to West Kilbride.
Dave is in Gosport knocking down an internal wall to turn a property's outside toilet into a cloakroom. 7/20
Dave is in Wellington helping a couple revamp the bathroom in their new home by fitting a stylish new suite.8/20
4/8. Under the hammer this time: a slice of royal wedding cake, a skeleton straight out of the wardrobe, a rare London tube map, and some vintage Soho sex-shop neon.
7/8. A German couple want to live closer to nature. They build a novel high-tech caravan that floats on water. But will their radical design work?

programmes.show_name: How To Have A Better Orgasm
programmes.show_description: Made by women for women, this film reveals proven orgasm-encouraging techniques to try at home. Featuring frank interviews with seven women about their sex lives.
Carry On-style comedy curio. A divorced man teaches girls how to swindle rich men - and in return he gets a cut of their takings. Contains nudity and 60s social attitudes.
Kevin McNally stars as Porthos, one of the Three Musketeers, in this award-winning short drama.
